Public Property ApplicationLicenses As IList(Of String)
member this.ApplicationLicenses : System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.

remarks.para: The list of application licenses must be a subset of available Batch service application licenses.
The permitted licenses available on the pool are 'maya', 'vray', '3dsmax', 'arnold'. An additional charge applies for each application license added to the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ApplicationPackageReference> ApplicationPackageReferences { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ApplicationPackageReference> ApplicationPackageReferences
Public Property ApplicationPackageReferences As IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)
member this.ApplicationPackageReferences : System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ApplicationPackageReference> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: Changes to application package references affect all new compute nodes joining the pool, but do not affect compute nodes that are already in the pool until they are rebooted or reimaged. There is a maximum of 10 application package references on any given pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool? AutoScaleEnabled { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> AutoScaleEnabled
Public Property AutoScaleEnabled As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.AutoScaleEnabled : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust according to the .

remarks.para: If true, the property is required, the pool automatically resizes according to the formula, and and must be null.
If false, one of the or properties is required.
The default value is false.

Public Property AutoScaleEvaluationInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the .
Docs.remarks: The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

MemberSignature.Value: public string AutoScaleFormula { get; set; }
.property instance string AutoScaleFormula
Public Property AutoScaleFormula As String
member this.AutoScaleFormula : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

remarks.para: For how to write autoscale formulas, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/. This property is required if is set to true. It must be null if AutoScaleEnabled is false.
The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the .

MemberSignature.Value: public void CommitChanges (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = default);

member this.CommitChanges : seq<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> -> unit

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Commits all pending changes to this to the Azure Batch service.

remarks.para: Updates an existing on the Batch service by replacing its properties with the properties of this which have been changed. Unchanged properties are ignored. All changes since the last time this entity was retrieved from the Batch service (either via , , or ) are applied. Properties which are explicitly set to null will cause an exception because the Batch service does not support partial updates which set a property to null. If you need to set a property to null, use the method.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Deletes this pool.

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the pool be deleted. The request puts the pool in the state. The Batch service will requeue any running tasks and perform the actual pool deletion without any further client action.
remarks.remarks: This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: The formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
The time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the AutoScale formula. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Enables automatic scaling on this pool.

remarks.para: The formula is checked for validity before it is applied to the pool. If the formula is not valid, an exception occurs.
You cannot enable automatic scaling on a pool if a resize operation is in progress on the pool.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets the result of evaluating an automatic scaling formula on this pool. This is primarily for validating an autoscale formula, as it simply returns the result without applying the formula to the pool.
Docs.returns: The result of evaluating the on this pool.

remarks.para: The formula is validated and its results calculated, but is not applied to the pool. To apply the formula to the pool, use .
This method does not change any state of the pool, and does not affect the or .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between its compute nodes.
Docs.remarks: Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the pool due to deployment restrictions on the nodes of the pool. This may result in the pool not reaching its desired size.

Docs.summary: Enumerates the compute nodes of this pool.

Specifies how to handle tasks already running, and when the nodes running them may be removed from the pool. The default is .

remarks.para: If you need to remove multiple compute nodes from a pool, it is more efficient to use the overload.
You can only remove nodes from a pool when the of the pool is . If the pool is already resizing, an exception occurs.
When you remove nodes from a pool, the pool's changes from to .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Public Sub Resize (Optional targetDedicatedComputeNodes As Nullable(Of Integer) = Nothing, Optional targetLowPriorityComputeNodes As Nullable(Of Integer) = Nothing, Optional resizeTimeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan) = Nothing, Optional deallocationOption As Nullable(Of ComputeNodeDeallocationOption) = Nothing, Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
member this.Resize : Nullable<int> * Nullable<int> * Nullable<TimeSpan> * Nullable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption> * seq<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> -> unit

Docs.param: The desired number of dedicated compute nodes in the pool. At least one of and is required.
The desired number of low-priority compute nodes in the pool. At least one of and is required.

The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool or removal of compute nodes from the pool. If the pool has not reached the target size after this time, the resize is stopped. The default is 15 minutes.
Specifies how to handle tasks already running, and when the nodes running them may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing. The default is .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Resizes this pool.

remarks.para: The resize operation requests that the pool be resized. The request puts the pool in the allocation state. The Batch service will perform the actual resize without any further client action, and set the allocation state to once complete.

You can only resize a pool when its is . You cannot resize pools which are configured for automatic scaling (that is, the property of the pool is true). If you decrease the pool size, the Batch service chooses which nodes to remove. To remove specific nodes, call .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: The desired number of dedicated compute nodes in the pool. At least one of and is required.
The desired number of low-priority compute nodes in the pool. At least one of and is required.

The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool or removal of compute nodes from the pool. If the pool has not reached the target size after this time, the resize is stopped. The default is 15 minutes.
Specifies how to handle tasks already running, and when the nodes running them may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing. The default is .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Resizes this pool.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The resize operation requests that the pool be resized. The request puts the pool in the allocation state. The Batch service will perform the actual resize without any further client action, and set the allocation state to once complete.

You can only resize a pool when its is . You cannot resize pools which are configured for automatic scaling (that is, the property of the pool is true). If you decrease the pool size, the Batch service chooses which nodes to remove. To remove specific nodes, call .
The resize operation runs asynchronously.

Docs.summary: Gets the resource usage statistics for the pool.
Docs.remarks: This property is populated only if the was retrieved with an including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null. The statistics may not be immediately available. The Batch service performs periodic roll-up of statistics. The typical delay is about 30 minutes.

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Stops a resize operation on this pool.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: This operation stops an ongoing resize operation on the pool. The pool size will stabilize at the number of nodes it is at when the stop operation is done. During the stop operation, the pool changes first to and then to .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The default value is 1. The maximum value is the smaller of 4 times the number of cores of the of the pool or 256.

.property instance string VirtualMachineSize
Public Property VirtualMachineSize As String

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the virtual machines in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.

remarks.para: For information about available sizes of virtual machines in pools, see Choose a VM size for compute nodes in an Azure Batch pool (https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-vm-sizes).
